intro: Deinbollia adusta, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers in the summer, which are followed by distinctive, inflated fruit capsules. Deinbollia adusta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in regions with low rainfall.
